revert: it is definitely called the zenith coordinate, or sometimes the colatitude, but never the "altitude" (which would presumably be radial).
Corrected "zenith" to "altitude" in the description of polar coordinates on a sphere. The altitude is the angle between a point and the sphere's equator; the zenith is the point where altitude=pi/2.
